alligator.description: One of Milo's cutest baby signs is 'alligator':  he snaps his hands together with gusto and makes a little grrr.
alligator.title: Alligator

babydog.description: Baby Dog now has a leash and is dragged around playgrounds.  He gets almost as many baths as Felix.   This, embarassingly, is mostly a comment on Felix's hygeine.
babydog.title: Babydog

farm1.description: Milo is fascinated by animals, so we paid a visit to the farm in Tilden park.
farm1.title: Farm 1

farm2.description: Felix's friend Jules came too.  We've quickly gotten plugged into the New School.
farm2.title: Farm 2

farm3.description: It took a while to make Milo understand that the celery was for the animals rather than himself.
farm3.title: Farm 3

hazel.description: Jennifer's baby Hazel.  She's four months younger than Milo but just as big.  When they both went after the same toy, he had quite a ferocious NO! -- something we're sure he learned from months of being on the other end of Felix's noes.  One time he actually handed Hazel a toy in order to take her current toy away -- another thing he must have picked up from us admonishing Felix.
hazel.title: Hazel

superfly1.description: It's a bird, it's a plane, it's...
superfly1.title: Superfly 1

superfly3.description: Never call him Superboy or Superfelix.  He insists on being Superman, he claims his cape is red, and today he said that he could raise the dead to life.
superfly3.title: Superfly 3

yogamoms1.description:
The Yogamoms at Arlington park, for a group birthday party.

Standing: Clara with Saia, Lucie with Milo
Sitting: Tara with Evan, Celia with Ariel, Katie with Jaime, Sara T. with Argil, Amy with Eliot, Patrice with Peter, Sara M. with Leo, Jen with Kai
yogamoms1.title: Yogamoms 1

yogamoms2.description: <u>Left to right</u>: Eliot, Ariel attacking Saia, Milo, Jaime, Kai, Argil, Leo and Peter.
yogamoms2.title: Yogamoms 2

yogamoms3.description: Milo brought his new singing puppy (a present from Linda and Papa John). Saia sings along. Argil is perplexed.
yogamoms3.title: Yogamoms 3

yogamoms4.description: Jen and baby Kai, a.k.a. little monkey.
yogamoms4.title: Yogamoms 4

zoo1.description: The Oakland zoo, where the animals are kept in cages to protect them from ravening Moseses.
zoo1.title: Zoo 1

zoo2.description: The Joyces accompanied us to the zoo. They're shutterbugs: Keenan and Amanda are both accomplished photographers, whereas Terry's metier is video.
zoo2.title: Zoo 2

zoo3.description: Milo looked intently at the sky tram for a while before happily exclaiming that it was a "bird train" (wing flap followed by a train whistle pull).
zoo3.title: Zoo 3

zoo3b.description: The kid's got smiling down pat.
zoo3b.title: Zoo3b

zoo3d.description: Dean and Felix ponder an animal.
zoo3d.title: Zoo3d

zoo4.description: "Petting zoo"?  The city of Oakland would thank you to call it a "sheep and goat contact yard".
zoo4.title: Zoo 4

zooz.description: After the zoo, we went to our house for a cookout.  Milo was introduced to hackey sacking, and approved mightily.
zooz.title: Zooz

description:
Felix is trying to figure out how things work, on both the physical and mental plane. He wants to know all the bones. He theorized this week that a thought is when air moves through your body and fills your stomach. He's great at labeling emotions: "When I hold a gun, it makes me feel important." He says the same thing about pretending to be Superman helping people.

Milo's exploding into full blown consciousness. It's rather breathtaking. He continues to radiate happiness from every pore, but now he actually does stuff. He claps in time to music, any music. He repeats short sequences of tones that you sing to him. He listens to birds and tries to imitate their different calls. When he does something he's proud of, he gives himself a little ovation. When he hears us congratulating Felix on something, he claps for Felix. And when you tickle him under the arms he laughs with the most charming abandon.

He laughed at his first joke: Lucie called him "mon chaton" (my kitten), a standard French term of endearment. He looked surprised, made the cat sign, pointed to himself, and started belly laughing.
title: September 18
